abstract: The filmmaker reflects on the rise of Korean cinema, balancing the physical with the cerebral and the significance of John Cho’s enunciation.
lead_paragraph: Even before he heard his name on the nominations telecast Monday morning, Bong Joon Ho, the Korean director of the six-time Oscar-nominated “Parasite” and a master of foreshadowing and suspense, spied what might have been a clue about his movie’s ultimate fate.
